intro: Anaphalis porphyrolepis, commonly known as the purple-leaved cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that is typically a striking purple or reddish hue, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are arranged in a compact cluster, typical of the Asteraceae family. Anaphalis porphyrolepis thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
